content: page 1 of 3 #ball-ble yarn oddments of fingering / 4ply weight yarn gauge n/a needles & notions 2 5mm dpns note you could also use a long circular needle for magic loop but since the pattern is worked in 3 sections it lends itself to dpns stitch markers tapestry needle card for ballband stuffing sizing finished bauble measures approx 3 25 / 8 cm tall ball-ble by lily kate france why not use yarn to knit more yarn ball-ble is a little bit silly but very cute and fun twisted rib and travelling stitches create a yarn-like texture on the tiniest ball of yarn you ever did see copyright 2024 lily kate france for personal use only pattern & items made from pattern may not be reproduced for sale page 2 of 3 #ball-ble notes construction the ball-ble is worked in two halves you start from the centre of the bauble under the ballband then work in a twisted stitch pattern that mimics the texture of a ball of yarn decreases are worked to gather the top you then pick up stitches in the cast on edge to work the second half exactly the same as the first filling the bauble with stuffing before gathering and securing the end pattern abbreviations & techniques note for a more seamless finish you could cast on using a provisional method but this is not p purl st s stitch es necessary since the centre will be hidden under pm place marker bor beginning of round the label anyway repeat repeat using your preferred method cast on 36 sts p2tog purl 2 together divide sts evenly between 3 needles 12 per k1tbl knit 1 stitch through back loop needle k2togtbl knit 2 together through back loop work rounds 1-19 of either chart or written ddec double decrease slip 1 stitch purlwise p2tog pass slipped stitch over instructions 3 sts m1l / m1lp make one left /purlwise break yarn and thread through final 3 sts pull insert left needle tip under bar between needles taught and draw yarn through to ws from front to back place bar on left needle tip knit / purl this stitch through the back loop rejoin yarn at cast on edge and pick up 1 in every st 36 sts note it does not particularly matter where you begin picking up stitches as this will not be visible under the ballband work second half exactly the same as first a few rounds before finishing second half stuff bauble as firmly as possible work the last few rounds add a final piece of stuffing and gather final 3 sts you will now bury the final end within the stuffing thread final yarn end onto a darning needle and poke into bauble passing out the other pattern support lilykate@jolihouse com side squish bauble slightly cut end then allow @lilykatemakes | #ball-ble bauble to unsquish so the end disappears into the stuffing follow me on instagram watch my youtube channel create label
